Isn't this a duplicate of https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-1984
Have you noticed the consequence of removing this line with the unused exclusions I think the 'usefulness' of this is still debatable as I mention in the issue. I have a PR to refine the dependencies, but I am not sure that doing the analysis for all the scopes is a huge gain considering that people will start doing manual exclusions that will last on later on as I mention in the issue.
R: @kennknowles CC: @jbonofre
R: @JingsongLi

@iemejia yes! I just found the other ticket first. It does look like #2821 supercedes this, though it doesn't tweak this setting from what I can tell. One thing I could use this PR for is distributing this setting into different modules so we can work each of them out one by one. It seems easy to do them all at once, but as you found out it is a source of some debate each time :-)

R: @jbonofre
PTAL, targeting 2.1.0 release since this is a pretty severe bug (not labeling the final pane).

Some thoughts here:

Do we have to enumerate all the cases in DSL test? I mean `bounded vs bounded`, `unbounded vs unbounded` etc. IMO we don't have to enumerate all the cases, just a happy test is enough, the DSL test is more like an integration test, all the cases should have already been covered by underlying UnitTest. Take JOIN for an example, all the join cases have covered by `BeamJoinRelBoundedVsBoundedTest`, `BeamJoinRelUnboundedVsUnboundedTest`, `BeamJoinRelUnboundedVsBoundedTest`,  we just need to make the JOIN feature integrates well the DSL methods, how do you think?
retest this please

There is clearly an issue with side inputs and overrides with this PR:

 - `ParDoTest.testBagStateSideInput`
 - `SplittableDoFnTest.testSideInput`
 - `SplittableDoFnTest.testWindowedSideInput`
 - `SplittableDoFnTest.testWindowedSideInputWithCheckpoints`
Thanks for the review @kennknowles. Addressed the comments, only thing remaining is logging error message. I can remove it as well, lmk.
